hackathon-description-text: A Hackathon at the University of Virginia.  This Hackathon was planned in memory of Connor Cormier, a second year at the University of Virginia, who enjoyed coding competitons.
hackathon-eligibility:
Teams can be anywhere from one to four members 
Open to anyone that is willing to participate!
hackathon-requirements:
Think about how can technology help solve social issues?  
Create and present quality software prototypes that hav some social implication 
Will need to pitch a 3 minute demo
hackathon-rules:
Teams can be anywhere from one to four members
To ensure a level field for all contestants, all code, music, design, art, SFX, and assets must be created during the duration of the Hackathon.  The only exception to this rule would include material that is freely available to the public (ex. public domain images, open source librares, etc.)
All teams retain full ownership of what they have created during the Hackathon!
hackathon-description-header: HACCK is a 24 hour hackathon on November 15 & 16 at the University of Virginia in honor of Connor Cormier.
